cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north-northeast then northeast, paralleling the Southeast coast and accelerating offshore toward the Mid-Atlantic/New England waters
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina–North Carolina border (around Cape Fear, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, and the tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Savannah River to the NC/VA border (Hurricane); Flagler/Volusia FL line to Savannah River FL–GA and NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA (Tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coast from Florida to Virginia with effects extending into the southern Mid-Atlantic including Delaware beaches
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in lower Delaware Bay and adjacent Atlantic beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent heavy rain bands possible Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware beaches; minor coastal flooding at high tide
